snippet: Some bishops participating in a special assembly convened by Pope Francis want the final report to emphasize the church’s boundaries on acceptable family structures.
abstract: Preliminary Vatican report that offered words of welcome and understanding to gays and unmarried couples has come under heavy criticism from some Roman Catholic bishops who want the final version to emphasize the church’s firm boundaries on acceptable family structures.

byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO

lead_paragraph: Some bishops participating in a special assembly convened by Pope Francis want the final report to emphasize the church’s boundaries on acceptable family structures.

headline.main: Initial Report From Vatican on Families Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Initial Report From Vatican on Families Is Criticized
